variable.label: Short Address
variable.tooltip: CV1 Sets the Primary (short, 2 digit) address

variable.label: Start voltage
variable.tooltip: CV2 Sets the starting voltage at throttle speed step 1

variable.label: Acceleration Rate
variable.tooltip: CV3 Sets the acceleration rate (delay). Higher number = slower rate

variable.label: Braking Rate
variable.tooltip: CV4 Sets the deceleration rate (delay). Higher number = slower rate

variable.label: Manufacturer Version No
variable.tooltip: CV7 This is the decoder software version identifier (read only)

variable.label: PWM Period
variable.tooltip: CV9 PWM

variable.label: BEMF Cutout
variable.tooltip:
CV10 Up to 127, this sets the speed step above which the intensity of BEMF control will be reduced
to zero. Values over 127 cause the BEMF to decrease as a percentage (up to 50%).

variable.label: Packet Timeout Value
variable.tooltip:
CV11 Sets the time period that is allowed to elapse between receipts of a valid packet
addressed to the decoder before a throttle shutdown occurs. Enter zero to disable.

variable.label: Analog Power Source
variable.tooltip:
CV12 Defines the type of power source the decoder should
switch to whenever a DCC signal is not present.
(Tip: Alternate Power Source must be enabled)

variable.label: Analog Mode Function Status - F1
variable.tooltip: CV13 bit 0; Check to enable function F1 when the unit is operating in analog power mode

variable.label: Analog Mode Function Status - F2
variable.tooltip: CV13 bit 1; Check to enable function F2 when the unit is operating in analog power mode

variable.label: Analog Mode Function Status - F3
variable.tooltip: CV13 bit 2; Check to enable function F3 when the unit is operating in analog power mode

variable.label: Analog Mode Function Status - F4
variable.tooltip: CV13 bit 3; Check to enable function F4 when the unit is operating in analog power mode

variable.label: Analog Mode Function Status - F5
variable.tooltip: CV13 bit 4; Check to enable function F5 when the unit is operating in analog power mode

variable.label: Analog Mode Function Status - F6
variable.tooltip: CV13 bit 5; Check to enable function F6 when the unit is operating in analog power mode

variable.label: Analog Mode Function Status - F7
variable.tooltip: CV13 bit 6; Check to enable function F7 when the unit is operating in analog power mode

variable.label: Analog Mode Function Status - F8
variable.tooltip: CV13 bit 7; Check to enable function F8 when the unit is operating in analog power mode

variable.label: Analog Mode Function Status - F0(f)
variable.tooltip: CV14 bit 0; Check to enable function F0(f) when the unit is operating in analog power mode

variable.label: Analog Mode Function Status - F0(r)
variable.tooltip: CV14 bit 1; Check to enable function F0(r) when the unit is operating in analog power mode

variable.label: Analog Mode Function Status - F9
variable.tooltip: CV14 bit 2; Check to enable function F9 when the unit is operating in analog power mode

variable.label: Analog Mode Function Status - F10
variable.tooltip: CV14 bit 3; Check to enable function F10 when the unit is operating in analog power mode

variable.label: Analog Mode Function Status - F11
variable.tooltip: CV14 bit 4; Check to enable function F11 when the unit is operating in analog power mode

variable.label: Analog Mode Function Status - F12
variable.tooltip: CV14 bit 5; Check to enable function F12 when the unit is operating in analog power mode

variable.label: Decoder Lock
variable.tooltip: CV16 Sets the unlock code that must be entered into the CV Unlock Register CV15 in order to access the decoder CVs

variable.label: Long Address
variable.tooltip: CV17/18 Sets the Extended (long, 4 digit) address

variable.label: Consist Address
variable.comment: CV19 Stores consist address. Range 0-127 (direction set in bit 7)
variable.tooltip: CV19 Stores consist address. Range 0-127

variable.label: Consist Direction
variable.comment: CV19 A consist address over 127 will also set this bit
variable.tooltip: CV19 bit 7, direction of loco in consist

variable.label: Consist Address Activation for F1
variable.tooltip: CV21 bit 0

variable.label: Consist Address Activation for F2
variable.tooltip: CV21 bit 1

variable.label: Consist Address Activation for F3
variable.tooltip: CV21 bit 2

variable.label: Consist Address Activation for F4
variable.tooltip: CV21 bit 3

variable.label: Consist Address Activation for F5
variable.tooltip: CV21 bit 4

variable.label: Consist Address Activation for F6
variable.tooltip: CV21 bit 5

variable.label: Consist Address Activation for F7
variable.tooltip: CV21 bit 6

variable.label: Consist Address Activation for F8
variable.tooltip: CV21 bit 7

variable.label: Consist Address Activation for F0(f) in Forward
variable.item: Consist Address Active For FL in Forward
variable.tooltip: CV22 bit 0

variable.label: Consist Address Activation for F0(r) in Reverse
variable.item: Consist Address Active For FL in Reverse
variable.tooltip: CV22 bit 1

variable.label: Consist Address Activation for F9
variable.tooltip: CV22 bit 2

variable.label: Consist Address Activation for F10
variable.tooltip: CV22 bit 3

variable.label: Consist Address Activation for F11
variable.tooltip: CV22 bit 4

variable.label: Consist Address Activation for F12
variable.tooltip: CV22 bit 5

variable.label: Consist Acceleration Rate (0-127)
variable.tooltip: CV23 When loco is in a consist, it's base acceleration rate is modified by this amount

variable.label: Consist Acceleration Sign
variable.tooltip: CV23 bit 7 Determines whether value is added to or subtracted from loco baseline acceleration rate

enumChoice.choice: Add value to base acceleration rate (increases acceleration delay)
Subtract value from base acceleration rate (decreases acceleration delay)

variable.label: Consist Braking Rate (0-127)
variable.tooltip: CV24 When loco is in a consist, it's baseline braking rate is modified by this amount

variable.label: Consist Braking Sign
variable.tooltip: CV24 bit 7 Determines whether value is added to or subtracted from loco baseline braking rate

enumChoice.choice: Add value to baseline braking rate (increases braking delay)
Subtract value from baseline braking rate (decreases braking delay)

variable.label: Speed Table Selection
variable.tooltip: CV25 Select a manufacturers speed curve, or use a curve you define yourself.

variable.label: Clear CVs (CVCLR)
variable.tooltip: CV30 Tip: To do a one-time decoder reset, use the menu [Reset] selection

enumChoice.choice: Clear all CVs at next power cycle

variable.label: Function Group 2 and 3 Exchange
variable.tooltip: CV30 Function Group 2 (F5-F8) assignments are swapped with Function Group 3 (F9-F12)

variable.label: Analog Whistle Control
variable.tooltip: CV47 Value of 0 = Disabled. See command station instructions for the value to enable this feature.

variable.label: Front light (F0F) effect generated
variable.tooltip: CV49 Determines the effect generated from the headlight

variable.label: Front light F0F phase
variable.tooltip: CV49 Alters the timing of the effect so that it's 180 degrees out of phase with the other effects

variable.label: Front light F0F grade crossing logic
variable.tooltip: CV49 Causes the lighting effect to become active only when the horn has been sounded

variable.label: Front light F0F Rule 17 mode
variable.tooltip:
CV49 Converts the headlight and backup light to independent, non-directional lights. Headlight
is controlled as if it were FX5, Function 5 and the backup light as FX6, Function 6.

variable.label: Front light F0F light type
variable.tooltip: CV49 Provides special compensation for lighting effect contrast when using LEDs

variable.label: Rear light F0R effect generated
variable.tooltip: CV50 Determines the effect generated from the backup light

variable.label: Rear light F0R phase
variable.tooltip: CV50 Alters the timing of the effect so that it's 180 degrees out of phase with the other effects

variable.label: Rear light F0R grade crossing logic
variable.tooltip: CV50 Causes the lighting effect to become active only when the horn has been sounded

variable.label: Rear light F0R Rule 17 mode
variable.tooltip:
CV50 Converts the headlight and backup light to independent, non-directional lights. Headlight
is controlled as if it were FX5, Function 5 and the backup light as FX6, Function 6.

variable.label: Rear light F0R light type
variable.tooltip: CV50 Provides special compensation for lighting effect contrast when using LEDs

variable.label: Lighting Flash Rate
variable.comment: 0 is fast, 15 is slow, 4 is recommended for start
variable.tooltip: CV59 Sets the overall flash rate of the Hyperlight effects

variable.label: Grade Crossing Hold Time
variable.tooltip: CV60 Sets the time (in seconds) an effect will stay on after the horn button is released

variable.label: F11 Braking Rate (0-127)
variable.comment: Additional braking when Fll activated (combined with CV4)
variable.tooltip: CV61 When F11 is pressed, locos baseline braking rate is modified by this amount

variable.label: F11 Braking Sign
variable.tooltip: CV61 Determines whether value is added to or subtracted from loco baseline braking rate

enumChoice.choice: Add value to baseline braking rate (increases braking delay)
Subtract value from baseline braking rate (decreases braking delay)

variable.label: Transponding Control
variable.tooltip: CV62 Compensates for incompatibilities that may occur when using some methods of transponding

variable.label: Analog Vstart
variable.tooltip: CV63 Analog mode motor start voltage

variable.label: Analog Vmax
variable.tooltip: CV64 Analog mode max motor voltage

variable.label: Forward Trim
variable.tooltip:
CV66 Allows the decoders overall throttle response in the forward direction to be adjusted up or down.
Values 1-127 will decrease motor voltage, 129-255 will increase it. A value of zero will disable.
Tip: this feature only active when speed tables are enabled.

variable.label: Reverse Trim
variable.tooltip:
CV95 Allows the decoders overall throttle response in the reverse direction to be adjusted up or down.
Values 1-127 will decrease motor voltage, 129-255 will increase it. A value of zero will disable.
Tip: this feature only active when speed tables are enabled.

variable.label: User Private ID #1
variable.tooltip: CV105 After reset equals minor revision code

variable.label: User Private ID #2
variable.tooltip: CV106 After reset equals default CV value configuration

variable.label: Westinghouse/Vacuum pumps
variable.tooltip: CV112 bits 0,1

variable.label: unknown for ZTC
variable.tooltip: CV112 bits 2,3

variable.label: Slip Rate Control
variable.tooltip: CV112 bits 4,5

variable.label: Cam Enable
variable.tooltip: CV112 bit 7

variable.label: Bell Ring Rate
variable.tooltip: CV114 bits 0-3

variable.label: ZTC 471 Whistle Selections
variable.tooltip: CV115 Select the primary whistle to use

variable.label: ZTC 472 Whistle Selections
variable.tooltip: CV115 Select the primary whistle to use

variable.label: ZTC 473 Whistle Selections
variable.tooltip: CV115 Select the primary whistle to use

variable.label: Whistle Selection
variable.tooltip: CV115 Choose whether to use the alternate whistle or a short toot of the primary whistle

variable.label: Engine Exhaust Rate
variable.tooltip:
CV116 For Auto-Exhaust synchronization, the chuff rate will be generated in proportion to the
throttle setting. Higher values = higher chuff rates; use zero to disable exhaust sound.

variable.label: Equalizer Control
variable.tooltip: CV153 bits 0-2

variable.label: Reverb Control
variable.tooltip: CV161 bits 0-2

variable.label: Whistle level
variable.tooltip: CV169 Reverb channel 0

variable.label: Bell level
variable.tooltip: CV170 Reverb channel 1

variable.label: Chuff level
variable.tooltip: CV171 Reverb channel 2

variable.label: Air/vac pump level
variable.tooltip: CV172 Reverb channel 3

variable.label: Dynamo level
variable.tooltip: CV173 Reverb channel 4

variable.label: Blower level
variable.tooltip: CV174 Reverb channel 5

variable.label: Rod Clank level
variable.tooltip: CV175 Reverb channel 6

variable.label: Steam Hiss level
variable.tooltip: CV176 Reverb channel 7

variable.label: Throttle Gain
variable.tooltip:
CV177 Specifies the DDE sensitivity to the difference between the throttle
setting and the actual locomotive speed. Set to zero to disable.

variable.label: Motor Load Gain
variable.tooltip: CV178 Specifies the DDE sensitivity to changes in the motor load. Set to zero to disable.

variable.label: Attack Time Constant
variable.tooltip:
CV179 Determines the amount of time needed before the DDE processor will begin reshaping
the audio signal once the motor or throttle input signal has begun to change.

variable.label: Decay Time Constant
variable.tooltip:
CV180 Determines the amount of time needed before the DDE processor will stop reshaping
the audio signal after the motor or throttle input signal has returned to normal.

variable.label: Exhaust Low Volume Limit
variable.tooltip:
CV181 Sets the maximum attenuation level of the exhaust sound when the
locomotive is under light load. (higher no. = greater attenuation)

variable.label: Exhaust High Volume Limit
variable.tooltip:
CV182 Sets the maximum volume level of the exhaust sound when the
locomotive is under heavy load. (higher no. = greater volume)

variable.label: Side Rod Clank Low Volume Limit
variable.tooltip:
CV183 Sets the maximum attenuation level of the side rod clanking sound when
the locomotive is under heavy load. (higher no. = greater attenuation)

variable.label: Side Rod Clank High Volume Limit
variable.tooltip:
CV184 Sets the maximum volume level of the side rod clanking sound when
the locomotive is under light load. (higher no. = greater volume)

variable.label: Filter Initial Frequency
variable.tooltip: CV185 Specifies the initial frequency of the DDE filter bank. (higher no. = higher frequency)

variable.label: Filter Control Gain
variable.tooltip:
CV186 Determines the sensitivity of the DDE filter bank to changes
in load and speed. (higher no. = greater sensitivity)

variable.label: Filter Damping
variable.tooltip: CV187 Sets the overall damping ratio of the DDE Filter Bank.

variable.label: BEMF Tracking Constant
variable.tooltip:
CV188 Sets the no load sense level for the DDE controller when
back-EMF is disabled, as a percentage of the track voltage.

variable.label: Bell-On Set Point
variable.tooltip: CV193 Specifies the throttle speed step where the automatic bell will first turn on

variable.label: Bell-Off Set Point
variable.tooltip: CV194 Specifies the throttle speed step where the automatic bell will turn off

variable.label: Grade Crossing Whistle Sensitivity
variable.tooltip: CV195 Specifies the positive rate of throttle change needed to activate the automatic grade crossing whistle

variable.label: Brake Squeal Sensitivity
variable.tooltip: CV196 Specifies the negative rate of throttle change needed to activate the automatic brake squeal

variable.label: Automatic Grade Crossing Whistle Enable (Analog Mode)
variable.tooltip: CV197 Enables the Automatic Grade Crossing Whistle in Analog Mode

variable.label: Automatic Whistle Signal Enable (Analog Mode)
variable.tooltip: CV197 Enables the Automatic Whistle Signal in Analog Mode

variable.label: Automatic Bell Enable (Analog Mode)
variable.tooltip: CV197 Enables the Automatic Bell in Analog Mode

variable.label: Automatic Brake Squeal Enable (Analog Mode)
variable.tooltip: CV197 Enables the Automatic Brake Squeal in Analog Mode

variable.label: Automatic Steam Blow Down Enable (Analog Mode)
variable.tooltip: CV197 Enables the Automatic Steam Blow Down in Analog Mode

variable.label: Automatic Grade Crossing Whistle Enable
variable.tooltip: CV198 Enables the Automatic Grade Crossing Whistle in Digital Mode

variable.label: Automatic Whistle Signal Enable
variable.tooltip: CV198 Enables the Automatic Whistle Signal in Digital Mode

variable.label: Automatic Bell Enable
variable.tooltip: CV198 Enables the Automatic Bell in Digital Mode

variable.label: Automatic Brake Squeal Enable
variable.tooltip: CV198 Enables the Automatic Brake Squeal in Digital Mode

variable.label: Automatic Steam Blow Down Enable
variable.tooltip: CV198 Enables the Automatic Steam Blow Down in Digital Mode

variable.label: Motor Kp Coefficient (0-255)
variable.tooltip: CV209 Specifies a gain factor for the proportional part of the PID motor control equation

variable.label: Motor Ki Coefficient (0-255)
variable.tooltip: CV210 Specifies a gain factor for the integral part of the PID motor control equation

variable.label: Motor Kd Coefficient (0-255)
variable.tooltip: CV211 ZTC feature, exact function unknown

variable.label: BEMF Feedback Intensity (0-255)
variable.tooltip: CV212 The CV value is interpreted as n/32 that is fed back from the control loop

variable.label: BEMF Feedback Sample Period (0-31)
variable.tooltip: CV213 Specifies the time period in mS (milliseconds) between measurements

variable.label: BEMF Sample Window Size (0-255)
variable.tooltip: CV214 Specifies a gain factor for the derivative part of the PID motor control equation

display.item: Side Rod Clank Low Volume Limit
Side Rod Clank Low Volume Limit
Side Rod Clank High Volume Limit
Side Rod Clank High Volume Limit
Automatic Grade Crossing Whistle Enable (Analog Mode)
Automatic Steam Blow Down Enable (Analog Mode)

label.label: CV 16 decoder lock. If set, must match the lock by setting CV15 in single CV programmer
